dublin_core.dcvalue: In microscopy regions of interest are usually much smaller than the whole slide area Various microscopy related medical applications such as telepathology and computer aided diagnosis are liable to benefit greatly from microscope auto positioning on previously defined regions of interest In this paper we present a method for image based auto positioning on a microscope slide The method is based on localization of a microscopic query image using a previously acquired slide map It uses geometric hashing a highly efficient technique drawn from the object recognition field The algorithm exhibits high tolerance to possible variations in visual appearance due to slide rotations scaling and illumination changes Experimental results indicate high reliability of the algorithm
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:34:20Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-01-31
IEEE transactions on information technology in biomedicine : a publication of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society
Visual positioning of previously defined ROIs on microscopic slides.
